intro: Calcearia puberula, commonly known as the velvetleaf or common sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and open areas. Its flowers are borne in dense inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects. Calcearia puberula is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
